snippet: Anders Behring Breivik, accused of killing 77 people at a camp last summer, was defiant and impassive as his trial opened in the July 2011 killings.
abstract: Anders Behring Breivik, self-described anti-Islamic militant who has admitted to killing 77 people in 2011, is defiant and impassive as he goes on trial in Oslo; Breivik proclaims in a statement to the court that he acted in self-defense, that he bears no criminal guilt and rejects the authority of the court.

byline.original: By MARK LEWIS and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Mark Lewis reported from Oslo, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: Anders Behring Breivik, accused of killing 77 people at a camp last summer, was defiant and impassive as his trial opened in the July 2011 killings.

headline.seo: Breivik Claims Self-Defense in Norway Killings
headline.main: Norwegian Man Claims Self-Defense in Killings
headline.print_headline: Norwegian Man Claims Self-Defense in Killings
